newsitem.title: PERU: PERU 56-DAY CDS DRAW 12.80 PCT AVG RATE AT SALE.
newsitem.headline: PERU 56-DAY CDS DRAW 12.80 PCT AVG RATE AT SALE.

text.p: The Central Reserve Bank of Peru said Wednesday it had accepted bids for 56-day Certificates of Deposit (CDs) worth 80 million soles at an effective average annual rate of 12.80 percent during a bank auction BCQZ.
The CDs have an August 14 starting date.
The accepted bids also had a minimum rate of 12.80 percent and a maximum rate of 12.80 percent, the bank said.
At the last CD auction Tuesday, 28-day CDs drew an average rate of 12.66 percent. At Wednesday's auction, the bank said it received bids on the CDs totalling 220.5 million soles.
The bank had offered 70 million soles worth of CDs.
The average effective annual interest rate for the certificates is used as an informal indicator for interest rates in the Peruvian financial system.
